Taiwan: Chinese settlers start moving into Yilan
Philippine: Simón de Anda y Salazar appointed Governor-General (1770–1776)
Indonesia: Captain James Cook stops at Onrust Island in the Bay of Batavia for repairs to his ship Endeavour on his round the world voyage.
Germany: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel was born.
France: The Dauphin Louis Auguste of France marries Archduchess Maria Antonia of Austria at the Chapel of Versailles.
Bhutan: Bhutan invades Sikkim, supported by troops from Cooch Behar.
Bangladesh: Bengal famine of 1770 causes the death of 15 million people.
Australia: English Lieutenant James Cook's expedition in HMS Endeavour charted the eastern coast, and claimed it for the British Crown. Australia was dubbed "terra nullius" i.e., according to the European legal precepts of the era, it was "owned" by no-one.
